proteomicsdb.org.requesttool.model.request

Class RequestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • proteomicsdb.org.requesttool.model.request.RequestHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RequestNotifier
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RunnableRequestHandler

    public class RequestHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements RequestNotifier
    Request Handler is the class that takes care of handling the connection, getting the received data into an intern data format and writing the data.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Intern data
      The received data will be put into this attribute.
      protected java.lang.String id
      A unique id to identify the RequestHandler.

    • Field Detail

      • data

        protected Intern data
        The received data will be put into this attribute. Protected, so that the RunnableRequestHandler can also access this.

      • id

        protected java.lang.String id
        A unique id to identify the RequestHandler. Protected, so that the RunnableRequestHandler can also access this.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RequestHandler

        public RequestHandler(InputConfigurationValidated validatedInputConf,
              OutputConfiguration anOutputConf,
              RequestListener aRequestListener)
        The standard constructor for the RequestHandler, that is used during the request phase. Assigns a unique id to the RequestHandler.
        Parameters:
        validatedInputConf - an InputConfigurationValidated that is used to build the link.
        anOutputConf - an OutputConfiguration that specifies how to deal with the received data
        aRequestListener - a RequestListener that is registered to the observers of the RequestHandler

      • RequestHandler

        public RequestHandler(java.lang.String aLink,
              RequestListener aRequestListener)
        The constructor for the first two Requests where the AllAPIsSpecification is built. Assigns a unique id to the RequestHandler. It does not get an InputConfiguration, but it directly gets the link to request the MetaData about the structure of the APIs. Careful: After constructing a RequestHandler with this constructor, do not call link #dumpData()}, for there is no OutputConfiguration and it will result in a NullPointerException.
        Parameters:
        aLink - a Link that is requested. Probably a MetaData request
        aRequestListener - a RequestListener that is registered to the observers of the RequestHandler

    • Method Detail

      • request

        public Intern request()
        Handles the request. It opens a connection to the url specified by the InputConfigurationValidated (or that was specified directly in the second constructor) using the Login Information defined in the SingletonLoginHandler and parses the JSON that is received from the ODatabase into an Intern. Notifies the registered RequestListeners of RequestEvent.CONNECTION_ESTABLISHED and RequestEvent.CONNECTION_CLOSED. If an error occurs, the method returns null. This MUST be handled by whomever has called request(). What type of error occured is told to the registered RequestListeners via RequestEvent.CONNECTION_ERROR and the corresponding RequestEvent.exception.
        Returns:
        The Intern containing the data.

      • dumpData

        public void dumpData()
        Writes data in the way specified in the OutputConfiguration given to the constructor. Notifies the registered RequestListeners of RequestEvent.WRITING_STARTED and RequestEvent.WRITING_FINISHED. If a RequestEvent.WRITING_ERROR occurs, the RequestHandler will notify its listeners of it.

      • register

        public void register(RequestListener observer)
        Registers a RequestListener to this RequestHandler, that will furthermore be notified of any state changes.
        Specified by:
        register in interface RequestNotifier
        Parameters:
        observer - the RequestListener to be added to the observers

      • unregister

        public void unregister(RequestListener observer)
        Removes a RequestListener from the observers, so it will not be notified anymore. Specifying a RequestListener that is not in observers will not change anything.
        Specified by:
        unregister in interface RequestNotifier
        Parameters:
        observer - the RequestListener to be removed from the observers

      • notifyObservers

        public void notifyObservers()
        Notifies all RequestListeners of the current state of the RequestHandler. Since state is not synchronized, it may occur, that two RequestListeners get different states from the same call of notifyObservers. This does not arise problems, because usually the state is only used to inform about progress and at the few significant states the RequestHandler will wait. (see also RunnableRequestHandler.run())
        Specified by:
        notifyObservers in interface RequestNotifier

      • changeState

        public final void changeState(RequestEvent event)
        Changes the state of the RequestHandler to the specified RequestEvent. Calls notifyObservers() to notify all registered RequestListeners of the change.
        Parameters:
        event - the new state the RequestHandler is in.

      • getData

        public Intern getData()
        Returns the data. May return null, if request() has not been succesfully called.
        Returns:
        the [@link #data}

      • getID

        public java.lang.String getID()
        Returns the unique id
        Returns:
        id
